summary: Implemented a new client-side QR generation pipeline (custom ISO/IEC-18004-style generator + mount-aware React hook) and integrated it into both ShareDialog and FlyerPage, with loading/error states and fallback messaging. However, the diff evidence focuses on generation failures/timeouts and does not clearly show user-facing guidance for the case where a QR code renders but is still not scannable.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add clear, English, user-facing error handling and recovery guidance specifically for the case where a QR code is rendered but cannot be scanned, including an obvious fallback path to share via the displayed App Link (copy/share) without implying the user’s phone is at fault.
missing_requirements.reason: The changes add error handling for QR generation failure/timeout (toast + overlay), but there is no clear evidence of guidance for the scenario where the QR code successfully renders yet a user still can’t scan it (e.g., a persistent ‘Having trouble scanning?’ helper with explicit Copy Link/App Link fallback).

hallucinated_features.description: Added a manual smoke-test checklist document for flyer download and QR scanning.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest did not ask for new documentation/tests; it only requested QR scannability fixes and UI error handling.
